title: What is the area of a rectangular box of height 3 feet with a length of 1.5 feet and breadth of 6 feet? - Quora

response.answer_text: I suppose you are talking about surface area. Each end has a surface area of hxbor 3x6 and there are two ends so that makes 36 sq ft. You will have two faces with areas of lxh and lxb so 1.5x3 x 2 or 9 and 1.5x6 x 2 or 18 so your total surface area will be 36 plus 9 plus 18 or 63 sq ft

Depends on which area you want. Two faces each 6 * 1.5 = 9 sq ft (top and bottom)Two faces each 3 * 6 = 18 sq ft (sides)Two faces each 3 * 1.5 = 4.5 sq ft (ends)Total area 63 square feet. Which dimension is length, width, height depends on how box is sitting. Floor space depends on which face is on floor. Amount of paint or wrapping determined by total area.
